Robert Sartin wrote:

>
> Still, we're looking at some automated ways to build and run selected
> tests (e.g. we have some tests that only work when java.awt.Robot can
> work and they won't run on our headless server).
>

I have extension of JUnit which allows you to apply filters on your
test cases. In other words you can specify wildcard mask which
is applied on each test case name in order to determine if the test
case should be executed or not. When starting test runner you can
specify include masks and exclude masks which will be applied
to all test case in your test suite.

Advantage of this filtering is that you can write your code once
and than select tests you wish to run without change in code.

If you or anybody else are interested in I can post it here with
some example.

Vita

P.S.: Additionally I refactored Ant's junit task to support this
tests filtering in its test and batchtest elements.

>
> Regards,
>
> Rob
